description: Conflict in Washington continues over the possible extension of the payroll tax cuts, as experts disagree whether the measures help or hurt the broader economy. The SEC is pushing for a rule that would disclose the income gap between the average American worker and CEOs. It is about to get a bit more difficult to be a cab driver in Chicago. And what kind of football team will make its home in Los Angeles?
byline: Jeff Tyler, John Dimsdale, David Brancaccio, Jeremy Hobson, Judy Collins, Scott Tong, Christopher Werth, Roland Buerk, Janet Brown, Kate McGough, Mary Dooe and Steve Chiotakis
itags: Marketplace Morning Report for Wednesday, December 14, 2011
title: Marketplace Morning Report for Wednesday, December 14, 2011
teaser: Conflict in Washington continues over the possible extension of the payroll tax cuts, as experts disagree whether the measures help or hurt the broader economy. The SEC is pushing for a rule that would disclose the income gap between the average American worker and CEOs. It is about to get a bit more difficult to be a cab driver in Chicago. And what kind of football team will make its home in Los Angeles?
